text: Agonistic activity of a <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - specific single-chain Fv constructed from the variable regions of mAb G28-5 .
A single-chain Fv ( sFv ) was expressed from the variable regions of the <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - specific mAb G28-5 .
The molecule bound <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> with a high affinity ( 2.2 nM ) and was a monomer in solution .

Surprisingly , G28-5 sFv was a potent <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> agonist that rapidly crosslinked <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on the cell surface but did not crosslink <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Ig in solution .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Binding crosslinked <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme CD40 <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Binding crosslink <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme CD40 <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: G28-5 sFv was a more potent agonist than G28-5 IgG and was able to stimulate <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> responses by B cells and monocytes .

G28-5 <extra_id_0> IgG <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> partially blocked , whereas G28-5 sFv augmented <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> responses during stimulation with natural ligand ( <extra_id_0> gp39 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - CD8 fusion protein ) .

These results indicate that the functional activity of ligands built from the binding site of G28-5 is highly dependent upon the size and physical properties of the molecule both in solution and on the cell surfaces .
